sourceMeaningMnemonic: While riding your <radical>scooter</radical>, you bang your <radical>forehead</radical> on the <radical>car</radical> in front. Your scooter's wrecked, so you have to <kanji>carry</kanji> it home. You'll need a lot of <kanji>luck</kanji> to get that scooter home safely.
meaningInfo: Imagine trying to carry your scooter down a busy road, with all the cars whizzing past. Your forehead is still hurting from that nasty bang. Good luck!
readingMnemonic: As you <kanji>carry</kanji> the scooter, your <kanji>luck</kanji> turns, and it starts to rain, so you pull out your <reading>um</reading>brella (<ja>うん</ja>). Now you're holding your scooter, your forehead, and an umbrella.
readingInfo: It's hard enough to carry a scooter in heavy traffic, but now you have to try to keep yourself and it dry with an umbrella too.
